_comment: All events go in the allEvents array. They are automatically sorted into upcoming/past based on the current date. Use format 'Month DD, YYYY' for dates. Optionally add 'image' field with filename from images/photos/ directory.

allEvents.title: Philosophy and Faith Symposium
allEvents.description: Join us for an evening exploring the intersection of philosophical inquiry and religious faith. Features panel discussion and Q&A session.
allEvents.speaker: Dr. Robert Williams, Georgetown University

allEvents.title: Annual Thomistic Debate Championship
allEvents.description: Watch as teams from across campus debate 'Resolved: Artificial Intelligence poses an existential threat to human dignity.' Open to all students.
allEvents.speaker: Moderated by Prof. Jennifer Blake

allEvents.title: Ethics in Modern Medicine
allEvents.description: A discussion on bioethics, medical decision-making, and the philosophy of healthcare in the 21st century.
allEvents.speaker: Dr. Marcus Johnson, Johns Hopkins

allEvents.title: Spring Philosophy Conference
allEvents.description: All-day conference featuring student paper presentations, keynote addresses, and networking opportunities for philosophy enthusiasts.
allEvents.speaker: Multiple Speakers

allEvents.title: Fall Semester Opening Reception
allEvents.description: Kicked off the academic year with an inspiring talk on 'The Life of the Mind' and welcomed new members to the institute.
allEvents.speaker: Dean Margaret Thompson

allEvents.title: Political Philosophy Roundtable
allEvents.description: Faculty and students engaged in lively discussion about justice, governance, and the common good in contemporary society.
allEvents.speaker: Panel of Regent Faculty

allEvents.title: C.S. Lewis Reading Group
allEvents.description: Discussed 'The Abolition of Man' and its relevance to modern educational philosophy.
allEvents.speaker: Student-led Discussion

allEvents.title: Ancient Philosophy Workshop
allEvents.description: Explored Aristotelian virtue ethics and its applications to contemporary moral challenges.
allEvents.speaker: Dr. Helen Patterson

allEvents.title: Aquinas and Natural Law
allEvents.description: Deep dive into Thomas Aquinas's natural law theory and its relevance to contemporary ethical debates.
allEvents.speaker: Dr. Michael Reynolds

allEvents.title: Philosophy Film Night: The Matrix
allEvents.description: Watch 'The Matrix' followed by a discussion on epistemology, free will, and the nature of reality.
allEvents.speaker: Film Discussion Led by Philosophy Faculty

allEvents.speaker: Dr. Michael Root
